author: Muralidhara Khajane
text:
Regretting successive governments’ apathy towards “good” cinema, renowned film-maker Adoor Gopalakrishnan on Sunday said Doordarshan, which has recommenced the telecast of the Indian Panorama and award-winning regional language feature films on its national channel, was “planning to reduce the amount being paid for regional films”.

At an interaction at BIFFes, he said Doordarshan is learnt to have decided to cut the money being paid from Rs. 25 lakh to Rs. 12.5 lakh.

Stating that the National Film Archives of India (NFAI) is digitalising his films which are 10 years old, Mr. Gopalakrishnan said some companies had uploaded his films on YouTube without his consent. “My films are literally being stolen,” he said in a fit of anger.

Though he disclosed that he was making a feature film after seven years, he said he did not want to discuss it as pre-publicity would come in his way of making the film.

Some companies have uploaded his films on YouTube without his consent, says the film-maker
title: My films are being literally stolen: Adoor
